data.text: @tigresseleanor @NjbBari3 @jneill @ONS @allacey_ @DailyMailUK @MailOnline They probably call not having a positive covid test “never having covid.”
@jneill @R_Hughes1 @russellviner @RCPCHtweets @ShamezLadhani @MAbsoud @LongCovidKids Rob said he admits he’s not a data expert. That’s why he’s reassured I reckon. Or Shamez is his Granny

@R_Hughes1 @russellviner @RCPCHtweets @ShamezLadhani @MAbsoud @LongCovidKids What % of primary and secondary school children experienced these symptoms for 12+ weeks prior to the pandemic Rob?

In 2019, for example?
@R_Hughes1 @jneill @russellviner @RCPCHtweets @ShamezLadhani @MAbsoud @LongCovidKids Because he’s your mate? Colleague? Chum? Dad?
@jneill @MailOnline @ONS There is a first time for everything
Perhaps Joe Davis @MailOnline would like to check his facts with the @ONS next time.
@jneill @russellviner @RCPCHtweets @ShamezLadhani @MAbsoud @LongCovidKids I am a parent and I find these data reassuring.

@daveanthony @ONS @allacey_ @DailyMailUK @MailOnline Yes, but not even asymptomatic.

Very little testing at all outside hospital settings in the first months of the pandemic.
